echo.value: Running tests in mode $SCMODE$ with command line options: $currentMode$

test.id: Start : Cleanup: persistent
Start: Cleanup: nonpersistent
Test 1: Create a cache
Test 2: Ensure -Xnolinenumbers is false
test.output: Cache contains only classes with line numbers

test.id: Test 2 - b: Add ROM classes to the existing shared cache without line numbers
Test 2 - c: Ensure -Xnolinenumbers is false and shared cache contains classes with line numbers and without line numbers
test.output: Cache contains classes with line numbers and classes without line numbers

test.id: Test 3: Build a new cache with -Xnolinenumbers
Test 4 - a: Ensure -Xnolinenumbers is true and all the content is without line numbers
test.output: Cache contains only classes without line numbers

test.id: Test 4 - b: Add ROM classes to the existing shared cache with line numbers
Test 4 - c: Ensure -Xnolinenumbers is true and shared cache contains classes with line numbers and without line numbers
test.output: Cache contains classes with line numbers and classes without line numbers

test.id: Test 4 - d: Build a new cache with -Xnolinenumbers and mprotect=all
Test 4 - e: Ensure -Xnolinenumbers is true and all the content is without line numbers
test.output: Cache contains only classes without line numbers

test.id: Test 4 - f: Add ROM classes to the existing shared cache with line numbers by using mprotect=all
Test 4 - g: Ensure -Xnolinenumbers is true and shared cache contains classes with line numbers and without line numbers
test.output: Cache contains classes with line numbers and classes without line numbers

test.id: Test 5: Create a cache with 500K memory and ensure vm starts successfully

Test 7: ensure zip cache sharing works and zip cache number is not 0
Test 8: ensure zip cache info is printed in printAllStats output

Test 14: JAZZ 31726 test 4 ensure -Xzero:none doesn't create zip caches

test.id: Test 57-a: Make sure that lambda classes work and get stored in the shared class cache
Test 57-b: Make sure that lambda classes are stored in the cache as orphans
Test 57-c: Make sure that when the program runs again lambda classes are used from the cache and not stored again
Test 58: Make sure that when the program runs again without the first lambda class, the second lambda class is still used from the cache and not stored again
Test 58 clean-up
Test 59-a: Run and store 10 lambda classes in the cache

Test 59-b: Do not run the first lambda class to check if a class with 1 digit index number gets matched to the one stored in the cache but with 2 digits index number (10th class in the previous run will be matched to 9th in this run)
Test 59 clean-up
Test 60-a: Make sure that lambda classes work and get stored in the cache when another function with lambda classes in another file is being called from the current file
Test 60-b: Make sure that the classes are used from the cache when the program is being run again
Test 60 clean-up
Test 61-a: Make sure that when shared lambdas are disabled, no lambda classes are stored in the cache
Test 61-b: Make sure that no lambda classes are in the cache
Test 61 clean-up
Test 62-a: Store the Anonymous Class and the Unsafe Classes (via app classloader and bootstrap classloader) in the cache
Test 62-b: Check whether they have been stored correctly
Test 62-c: Make sure the classes are loaded from the cache and work properly
Test 62-d: Check whether the classes are loaded correctly and work properly after the implementation has been modified
Test 62 clean-up
Test 63-a: Only store the Anonymous Class in the cache
Test 63-b: Check whether the Anonymous Class has been stored correctly
Test 63 clean-up
Test 64-a: Only store the Unsafe Class in the cache
Test 64-b: Check whether the Unsafe class has been stored correctly
Test 64 clean-up
Test 65-a: Do not store the Anonymous Class and the Unsafe Class in the cache
Test 65-b: Make sure none of the classes has been stored in the cache
Test 66: Processor Features PrintStats Test : Ensure -Xshareclasses:printStats cache contains processor feature info
At end destroy cache for cleanup
